results.title: The Lemonade stand: what's fair?
results.creator_credit: Thomas Smith and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Uses the illustration of two boys who open a lemonade stand in order to present a study of the meaning of commitment, obligations, and responsibility to others. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: The Leith Ratten case
results.creator_credit: Tristram Miall, Murray Travers and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: A dramatised recreation of the trial and conviction of Leith Ratten for the murder of his wife in Shepparton in 1970. Examines the events preceeding the trial and reexamines the evidence. Stars Danny Adcock and Julie Dawson.

results.title: The Legend of Robin Hood: black arrow
results.creator_credit: Walter J Hucker and Air Programs International
results.brief_description: Introduced by John-Michael Howson, this tape includes two tales for the family to enjoy. “The Legend of Robin Hood”; King Richard leaves for England to crusade in the Holy Land. He leaves the kingdom in the hands of his brother, Prince John. All does not go well however, and Prince John and his Barons use the power recently invested in them to increase their estates at the expense of the citizens. Only one citizen dares to protest against their shoddy behaviour; Robin of Locksley, who becomes an outlaw and adopts the name, Robin Hood. Directed by Zoran Janic. “Black arrow”; Squire Richard Shelton, heir to the Turnstall Estate sets out to join the Lancastrian Army. On his way he meets the mysterious brotherhood of the Black Arrow and discovers startling news. His guardian, Sir Daniel Brackley, is plotting to steal his estate and may have been involved in the death of Richard’s father. Directed by Leif Gram.

results.title: The Legend of Mark Twain
results.creator_credit: Karl Genus, Daniel Wilson, Benchmark Films and Jules Power Productions
results.brief_description: Follows Samuel Clemens’ life and career on the American literary scene and dramatises selections from two of his well-known classics - “The Celebrated jumping frog of Calaveras County” and “The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn”. Cast includes David Wayne.

results.title: The Legend of King Arthur
results.creator_credit: Rodney Bennett, Ken Riddington and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: The legend of King Arthur, a tale of love, sorrow, courage and endeavour set in the cruel and barbaric Dark Ages, where magic still weaves its mystic influence over the affairs of men and kings. Merlin the mysterious old wizard has a vision of a new age of justice and chivalry and chooses young Arthur, son of Uther, to carry the torch of enlightenment.

results.title: The Legend of Damien Parer
results.creator_credit: Gil Brealey, Kip Porteous and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: A record of the life and work of war photographer Damien Parer who, after working with the Commonwealth Film Unit, left with the first A.I.F. contingent for the Middle East. Includes extracts from some of his films and interviews with his wife and other close associates. (Awards: Winner of Silver Award, Documentary category, Australian Film Awards, 1965)

results.title: The Left wall of Cenotaph Corner
results.brief_description: Cenotaph Corner in North Wales is a rock climber’s challenge. Actual footage of a climb up this rock face illustrates the magnitude of skill necessary. The film discusses the type of equipment used in rock climbing.

results.title: The League of Nations: the first experiment
results.creator_credit: George Movshon and United Nations Television
results.brief_description: Described as, by the titles, “An account of the first attempt by nations to build an organisation to maintain the peace.” Contains original footage from WWI re the armistice and political accounts of movements during the war.
